The hot African sun was really a scorcher out there on the rolling 
grasslands where animals tried to hide in what shade they could possibly 
find, but with their internal air-conditioning systems the group of 
scientific Decepticons weren�t any the wiser to the sufferings of any of the 
organics in the reign.
Because they were just fine.

AND busy recovering any of their research equipment that might of survived 
the explosion of their ship.
Which wasn�t much.
A few portable scanners that were so low on power they didn�t work anyway, a 
voice recorder, and 3 energon cubes that hadn�t been smashed with the rest 
when the storage unit was totaled on impact.
All in all�that was more then they�d expected to fine. So no complaints came 
from any of THEM.
Finally, after thay�d done what they could, the 4 of them regrouped on a 
small rise away from the wreckage where they�d put the things they�d found. 
And then watched on as their mighty ship was reduced to nothing more then 
metallic ashes. Along with everything else inside.

Blue Flame heaved a heavy sigh as Sand Storm plopped down on the grass 
beside him.
� No ship, no way back home, and only 3 energon cubes between the 4 of us. 
What now?�
All optics were turned to Diesel Runner, who still stood tall and unwavering 
despite the same heavy, sinking feeling she secretly shared with the others. 
But ignored.
Instead of simply giving up much like Sand Storm who pouted in the grass 
from loosing his CD collection in the crash, D.R. took action and gathered 
up the few energon cubes they had. Then, very un-Decepticon-like, handed 
them over to her crew and disregarded their surprised expressions.

� You re-energize yourselves. Because our work isn�t done just because our 
ship is gone.�
Blue Flame blinked, a bit confused as he held the glowing cube his leader�d 
just given him. �But�what about you, Diesel? You need energy too.�
The big black semi-transformer only shook her head. � Not as much as you 
three. And I need your energy levels at maximum for the work that we still 
have ahead.� She explained.
Although Sand Storm gave her a funny look. � What work? The ship�s gone. 
Nothin but a pile of sparkly ashes.� He said over the top of his cube.
But D.R. was already 2 steps ahead of him and pointed to the ashes the dune 
bunny�s referred to.
� The radioactive material from the core of our ship�s engine is still 
potent, even as ashes. And it�ll harm the environment of this lush planet 
unless we dispose of it properly.� She explained before turning back to her 
crew. � The last thing I want is this planet to be contaminated before we 
get the chance to study it. So drink up, because you�re going to help be 
dilute that core material.�

Sand Storm raised his cube up. � That�s a good enough reason for me.� he 
said before tossing back his energon beverage. Followed quickly by Dark 
Cloud. And then by Blue Flame, who paused for only a moment before drinking 
up his portion too.
